intro: Epilobium × palatinum nothosubsp. palatinum, commonly known as the common willow herb, is a hybrid plant in the evening primrose family (Onagraceae). It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers with four petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, riverbanks, and along roadsides. This species is widely distributed across temperate regions of Europe and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
